canonical_explanation.text: Perimeter is the total distance around a shape. Area is the amount of surface covered by a shape. For a rectangle: Perimeter = 2 × (length + breadth), Area = length × breadth. For a square: Perimeter = 4 × side, Area = side × side. Shapes with the same perimeter can have different areas, and shapes with the same area can have different perimeters.
rules: Area of rectangle = length × breadth (in square units)
Area of square = side × side (in square units)
Perimeter is measured in units (cm, m)
Area is measured in square units (sq cm, sq m, cm², m²)
Same perimeter does not mean same area

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a rectangle with length 8 cm and breadth 5 cm is:
The perimeter of a square with side 6 cm is:
The area of a rectangle with length 7 cm and breadth 4 cm is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area of rectangle = l × b = 7 × 4 = 28 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a square with side 9 cm is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area of square = side × side = 9 × 9 = 81 sq cm.

questions.question_text: Perimeter is the distance around a shape.
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter is the total length of the boundary of a shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = total distance around the outside of a shape.

questions.question_text: Area is measured in square units.
questions.explanation_correct: Area measures the surface covered, so it is always in square units (sq cm, sq m, cm², m²).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = surface covered, measured in square units.

questions.question_text: A rectangular garden is 12 m long and 8 m wide. How much fencing is needed to go around it?
A hall floor is 10 m long and 6 m wide. What is the area of the floor?
A square playground has a perimeter of 80 m. Each side is:
A square room has side 5 m. What is its area?
Two rectangles both have perimeter 20 cm. Rectangle A is 6 cm × 4 cm, Rectangle B is 8 cm × 2 cm. Which has more area?
questions.explanation_correct: A: 6 × 4 = 24 sq cm. B: 8 × 2 = 16 sq cm. Same perimeter but A has more area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Same perimeter doesn't mean same area. A = 24 sq cm > B = 16 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A garden 15 m long and 10 m wide needs fencing at Rs 50 per metre. The total cost is:
A room is 8 m long and 6 m wide. Carpet costs Rs 200 per sq m. Total cost to carpet the room:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = 48 sq m. Cost = 48 × Rs 200 = Rs 9,600.

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a rectangle is 36 cm and its length is 12 cm. What is its breadth?
The area of a rectangle is 72 sq cm and its length is 9 cm. What is its breadth?
Perimeter of a square = 4 × ___
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side, since all four sides are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has 4 equal sides, so perimeter = 4 × side.

questions.question_text: Area of a rectangle = length × ___
Priya wants to put a border around a rectangular painting 30 cm by 20 cm. How much border tape does she need?
A rectangle and a square both have area 36 sq cm. The square has side 6 cm. If the rectangle's length is 9 cm, its perimeter is:
questions.explanation_correct: Rectangle breadth = 36 ÷ 9 = 4 cm. Perimeter = 2(9 + 4) = 2 × 13 = 26 cm. (Square perimeter = 24 cm.)

questions.question_text: A rectangular field is 50 m by 30 m. Rohan walks around it 3 times. Total distance walked:
How many square tiles of side 1 m are needed to cover a floor 4 m by 3 m?
questions.explanation_correct: Area of floor = 4 × 3 = 12 sq m. Each tile = 1 sq m. Tiles needed = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = 12 sq m. Each tile covers 1 sq m. Need 12 tiles.

questions.question_text: A square park of side 25 m is to be fenced. Fencing costs Rs 75 per metre. Total cost:
A rectangle and a square can have the same perimeter but different areas.
questions.explanation_correct: For example: square side 5 cm (perimeter 20, area 25) vs rectangle 6×4 (perimeter 20, area 24). Same perimeter, different areas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yes. Perimeter 20: square 5×5 = area 25, rectangle 6×4 = area 24. Different areas.

questions.question_text: A rectangular plot has perimeter 100 m and length 30 m. Find the breadth:
A square has area 49 sq cm. What is its side?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Side = square root of area = square root of 49 = 7 cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a rectangular room is 48 sq m. If the length is 8 m, what tiles of side 2 m are needed?
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 48 sq m. Each tile area = 2 × 2 = 4 sq m. Tiles = 48 ÷ 4 = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Room area = 48 sq m. Tile area = 4 sq m. 48 ÷ 4 = 12 tiles.

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a rectangle is 30 cm. If the breadth is 5 cm, the length is:
Area of a square with side 12 cm = ___ sq cm
Which has more area: a square of side 8 cm or a rectangle of 10 cm × 5 cm?
questions.explanation_correct: Square area = 8 × 8 = 64 sq cm. Rectangle area = 10 × 5 = 50 sq cm. Square has more area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Square = 64 sq cm > Rectangle = 50 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A farmer has a rectangular field 40 m by 25 m. He wants to plant grass that costs Rs 10 per sq m. The total cost:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = 1000 sq m. Cost = 1000 × Rs 10 = Rs 10,000.

questions.question_text: Perimeter is measured in:
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter is a length, so it is measured in units like cm, m, km.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter = total length, measured in cm, m, etc. (not square units).

questions.question_text: Area is measured in:
questions.explanation_correct: Area measures surface, so it uses square units: sq cm, sq m, cm², m².
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area is in square units: cm², m², sq cm, sq m.

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a rectangle with length 15 cm and breadth 10 cm is:
A rectangular playground is 60 m by 40 m. How many laps make 1 km?
Among all rectangles with the same perimeter, the square has the largest area.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, for a given perimeter, the square (equal length and breadth) gives the maximum area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a fixed perimeter, the shape closest to a square has the maximum area.

questions.question_text: A rectangular kitchen is 4 m by 3 m. Each sq m tile costs Rs 150. Total tiling cost:
A wire is bent into a rectangle 8 cm by 6 cm. If the same wire is bent into a square, the side is:
questions.explanation_correct: Wire length = perimeter of rectangle = 2(8+6) = 28 cm. Square side = 28 ÷ 4 = 7 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wire = rectangle perimeter = 28 cm. Square side = 28 ÷ 4 = 7 cm.

questions.question_text: If the length of a rectangle is doubled and breadth stays the same, the area becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: Original area = l × b. New area = 2l × b = 2(l × b). The area doubles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: New area = 2l × b = 2 × original area. It doubles.

questions.question_text: If the side of a square is doubled, its perimeter:
questions.explanation_correct: Original perimeter = 4s. New perimeter = 4(2s) = 8s = 2 × 4s. The perimeter doubles.

questions.question_text: If the side of a square is doubled, its area:
questions.explanation_correct: Original area = s². New area = (2s)² = 4s² = 4 × original. Area becomes 4 times.
questions.explanation_incorrect: New area = (2s)² = 4s². The area becomes 4 times (quadruples).

questions.question_text: A square handkerchief has side 25 cm. Lace is sewn around its border. How much lace is needed?
Rectangle A: 12 cm × 3 cm. Rectangle B: 9 cm × 4 cm. Compare their areas:
questions.explanation_correct: A: 12 × 3 = 36 sq cm. B: 9 × 4 = 36 sq cm. Equal areas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A = 36 sq cm. B = 36 sq cm. Same area!

questions.question_text: The perimeter of a rectangle with l = 20 cm and b = 10 cm is ___ cm.
A farmer's rectangular field is 200 m by 150 m. How much does it cost to plough at Rs 5 per sq m?
The perimeter of a rectangle is always greater than the perimeter of a square with the same area.
questions.explanation_correct: For the same area, a square has the minimum perimeter among all rectangles. So any non-square rectangle with the same area will have a larger perimeter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has the smallest perimeter for a given area. Any rectangle (that is not a square) with the same area has a larger perimeter.

questions.question_text: A photo is 15 cm long and 10 cm wide. What is the area of the photo?
Anu has a rectangular garden 20 m × 15 m. She wants to make a 1 m wide path around it. What is the perimeter of the outer boundary?
questions.explanation_correct: Outer dimensions: (20+2) × (15+2) = 22 m × 17 m. Perimeter = 2(22+17) = 2 × 39 = 78 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Path adds 1 m on each side. Outer: 22 × 17. P = 2(22+17) = 78 m.

questions.question_text: The formula for perimeter of a rectangle is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: P = 2(l + b). This accounts for both pairs of sides.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true?

options.text: Same perimeter always means same area
Same area always means same perimeter
Same perimeter can give different areas, and same area can give different perimeters
Perimeter and area are always equal

questions.explanation_correct: Shapes with the same perimeter can have different areas (e.g., square 5×5 vs rectangle 8×2, both P=20). Shapes with the same area can have different perimeters too.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter and area are independent: same P can give different A, and same A can give different P.

questions.question_text: A square park has area 100 sq m. How much fencing is needed to enclose it?
